thread.title: Heat-Pelicans preview: Miami Heat at New Orleans Pelicans
thread.title_full: Heat-Pelicans preview: Miami Heat at New Orleans Pelicans - Sun Sentinel

author: Ira Winderman
title: Heat-Pelicans preview: Miami Heat at New Orleans Pelicans
text:
When/Where: 8 p.m., Smoothie King Center, New Orleans.
TV: Fox Sports Sun. Radio: 790-AM, 106.3-FM.
Scouting report: This concludes the preseason for both teams . . . This is the only game the Pelicans will play on their home court this preseason, with their previous "home" exhibitions in Jacksonville and Lexington, Ky., where Anthony Davis previously played . . . The Pelicans next play next Tuesday in their regular-season opener at Golden State . . . The Heat next play next Wednesday against visiting Charlotte in their season opener . . . The Heat went 0-2 against the Pelicans last season, with the teams again to meet twice this season . . . Beyond hiring former Heat coach Alvin Gentry to place Monty Williams, the Pelicans are largely intact from last season, with the minor additions of Nate Robinson, Kendrick Perkins, Bo McCalebb, Alonzo Gee and Chris Douglas-Roberts . . . For the Heat, Goran Dragic (illness) and Greg Whittington (illness) are out . . . For the Pelicans, Norris Cole (ankle), Quincy Pondexter (knee), Luke Babbitt (hamstring), Tyreke Evans (knee), Omer Asik (calf) and Alexis Ajinca (hamstring) are out.
-- Ira Winderman
 Anthony Davis Kendrick Perkins Alonzo Gee Tyreke Evans Golden State Warriors Monty Williams Alexis Ajinca
